page.title: 02COMMON LAND HISTORY STROUD
page.content: { {MINCHINHAMPTON COMMON: {EARTHWORKS}known as the Bulwarks are believed to be part of a defence system for Amberley Camp.Consists of a bank and ditch about 600m. in length.Little excavation has taken place but finds in the ditch were of Roman origin whilst those in the bank were both Roman and middle Iron Age. {OLD LODGE INN}built by Lords of Manor in 17th Century,now golf clubhouse, next to {NEW LODGE INN}built in 1895. {HORSE RACING} was stopped in early 19th Century by David Ricardo. {CRICKET PITCH}rolled for Brimscombe Church cricket club on south end of common in 1912.Not used today.
